body.p: Born in Benton, New York. Moved to Franklin County, Indiana around 1814. Studies law in Indiana, and later Cincinnati, Ohio. Moved to Covington, Kentucky and studied under Jefferson Phelps. In 1831 passed the bar and became an attorney. Married Angelina Clemons in 1832. Was the first mayor of Covington from 1834-1835, and later the city clerk. Resumed private practice until 1849, when he was elected to the Covington city council, President of the Covington & Lexington Railroad from 1853-1856. During the lead up to the war Benton was pro-Union, and when the Civil War began Benton aligned with the Republican party. Representative in the Kentucky Legislature as a Union party member from 1863-1865. Ran for the Kentucky. Senate in 1865, and won the election. His political career ended when he was ejected from his position in 1866 after he lost a challenge regarding the legality of the election.
